channel.title: Feedback on Patch 1.0.1
channel.description:
I am having the full brightness issue, too. Changing the game to the dedicated graphic card just improved it a little (I noticed that the glare of the light sources where now barely visible, whereas they weren't before), but still far from ok. I tried adding
mat_dxlevel 95 mat_fullbright 0 mat_hdr_level 2
to autoexec.cfg, aswell as installing the patch but neither did work for me.
My specs are: OS: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium, x64-based Version: 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601 Laptop Model: Dell Inspiron 7520 Processor Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz, 2501 MHz, 2 Cores, 4 logical processors BIOS-Version/-Date: Dell Inc. A02, 17.05.2012 SMBIOS-Version 2.7 graphic-card: AMD Radeon HD 7730M / 2048 MB / Memory: 6GB DDR 3
Thanks for working all this out! ![2015-05-07_00001.jpg|690x500](upload://dIXwtIfIzMxC7MrcckYW4vbMS8.jpeg)

item.title: Feedback on Patch 1.0.1
item.dc:creator: russ_sentient
item.description:
When I first opened the game after installing the steam version, the menu background scene was lighted appropriately. I went into video settings and changed textures to max, and set the bloom setting below and water to reflect everything. I started a new game and everything was full bright. Restarted the game and then the menu background was fullbright as well. I changed everything back to default settings and restarted and it seemed to fix the problem, then steam patched the game and I haven’t had any trouble since even changing video settings.

I am running Windows 7, AMD X4 and GeForce GTX 560.

The patch seems to have fixed the problem for me.
